entries.meaning: (arithmetic) A number by which another (the multiplicand) is to be multiplied.
examples: In the expression 5 × 7, the "5" is a multiplier.
The score multiplier increases each time you complete a level of the video game.

entries.meaning: (grammar) An adjective indicating the number of times something is to be multiplied.
(economics) A ratio used to estimate total economic effect for a variety of economic activities.

definitionGroups.group: (physics) Any of several devices used to enhance a signal

entries.meaning: (physics, obsolete) a coil; when Johann Schweigger in 1820 invented the electric coil, increasing the electro-magnetic field from a single wire, this invention was called a multiplier.

examples: Shallots are the most prolific of all the multipliers, and easier to grow than onions.
